channel.title: The Thirsty Mage RPG Podcast
channel.description: Enjoy RPGs and having a pint? So do the folks at The Thirsty Mage Pub. Each podcast begins with a short discussion about a new and exciting drink and quickly transitions to a discussion about an RPG or related topic. We cover a wide range of subjects - Square Enix, ATLUS, JRPGs, or pretty much anything an RPG fan would enjoy.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Thirsty Mage with David Lloyd
channel.itunes:summary: Enjoy RPGs and having a pint? So do the folks at The Thirsty Mage Pub. Each podcast begins with a short discussion about a new and exciting drink and quickly transitions to a discussion about an RPG or related topic. We cover a wide range of subjects - Square Enix, ATLUS, JRPGs, or pretty much anything an RPG fan would enjoy.
channel.itunes:keywords: RPG, rpg, nintendo, videogames, video games, Nintendo, PlayStation, PS4, XBOX, Switch, Square, Atlus, JRPG, WRPG

item.title: Inventory Systems and Unique Items
item.itunes:subtitle: This week in the pub, a new patron joins a discussion about some of the different styles of inventory systems in RPGs and our favourite items from those series.
item.description:
This week in the pub, a new patron joins a discussion about some of the different styles of inventory systems in RPGs and our favourite items from those series. Last Call wraps up the episode with a look at some titles who could have benefited from a different inventory strategy.
On the panel: Thirsty Mage Host - David Lloyd NWR Reviews Editor - Jordan Rudek LadiesGamers.com Reviewer - Paige Detlefsen
Beer of the Night - Blanche De Chelsea - Gainsbourg - White IPA
Follow Paige on: Twitter: @PaigeGGuy YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCTMxpDDy3x6wlNz_3Apn0Yg
Instagram: @TheThirstyMage Twitter: @TheThirstyMage Discord: discord.gg/kwR9kxC Email: David@TheThirstyMage.com
item.itunes:summary: This week in the pub, a new patron joins a discussion about some of the different styles of inventory systems in RPGs and our favourite items from those series.

item.title: Retro Replay - Final Fantasy V
item.itunes:subtitle: A Final Fantasy title from the SNES era, this is our happy place.
item.description:
The retro team over at The Thirsty Mage travelled to our happy place: An RPG from the SNES era. And not just any RPG, a Final Fantasy title that many probably haven’t had the chance to play. The fellows at the pub finished Final Fantasy V for the first time and provide their insight into the often overlooked classic.
On the panel: Thirsty Mage Host - David Lloyd NWR Reviews Editor - Jordan Rudek RFN Co-Host - Guillaume Veillette
Twitter: @TheThirstyMage Discord: discord.gg/kwR9kxC Email: David@TheThirstyMage.com
item.itunes:summary: A Final Fantasy title from the SNES era, this is our happy place.
item.itunes:keywords: rpg,nintendo,video,games,PlayStation,switch,xenoblade,thirsty,mage,david,lloyd,vita,final,fantasy,Sakaguchi, yoko shimomura, Final Fantasy V

item.title: Know A Developer - Snowcastle Games
item.itunes:subtitle: On this week's Know Your Developer, I sit down with the CEO and Game Director of Earthlock, Bendik Stang.
item.description:
An interview with the Game Director of Earthlock
On this week's Know Your Developer, I sit down with the CEO and Game Director of Earthlock, Bendik Stang.
Ben and his team over at Snowcastle Games released Earthlock for the Nintendo Switch a little over a month ago and he joins me in a conversation about what it was like to make an RPG and some behind the scenes details about game development.
Twitter: @TheThirstyMage Discord: discord.gg/kwR9kxC Email: David@TheThirstyMage.com
item.itunes:summary: On this week's Know Your Developer, I sit down with the CEO and Game Director of Earthlock, Bendik Stang.
